Text: I know, everything was \n already delivered as \n promised.
We made it through! \n Let's run for it.
Huh?
Vogo, were you \n in on this!?
What about this boat?
But he is \n Fi's family...
Kat, take out the \n troops from the \n first landing craft.
Alright, I'll help, but \n only because of Fi!
Phew, we did it!

You don't know when 
 to give up, do you? 
 Vogo has made some 
 serious enemies.
Your people dropped the \n stuff off at my mansion \n a little while ago.
All that's left is \n signing the receipt.
Too easy... \n They'll be back with \n reinforcements.
How...?
More of them!?
WHA-!?
R-Right! I knew what you \n were up to all along! \n That's my brother!
Fall back! Vogo... You \n may have survived today, \n but we will get you.

Something tells me 
 he didn't have a clue 
 what was going on. 
 Some brother...
They're coming from \n below us.
Vogo, Vogo... What took \n you so long?
In as much as he told \n me to "use my mind, \n not his money."
I know, but he \n is my brother.
My sincerest apology, we \n hit a bit of a snag on \n the way in...
And, Fi... How can you \n help Vogo knowing \n what he's like?
Huh?
Vogo, this is \n all your fault!
The crates are empty.

They were willing 
 to help as soon as 
 I told 'em I'd take 
 care of you.
But the delivery is \n sitting over there on \n the ship, isn't it?
They didn't notice our \n people making the \n delivery.
It worked. They were \n all so focused on \n attacking us...
Is that the sound of an \n engine? ... Wait, a lot \n of engines.
Fall back! Vogo... You \n may have survived today, \n but we will get you.
It's not going to be \n that easy.

Full speed ahead, 
 we need to make 
 this delivery as 
 soon as possible.
Well, I guess everything \n worked out in the end.
I had a lot of help from \n Vogo's enemies - he has \n a lot of 'em!

If we can just reach 
 the harbor, they 
 won't be able to lay 
 a hand on us.
Vogo! We're not letting \n you get away with this.
H-How did they defeat \n all of those soldiers!?
Where did they find \n so many mercenaries \n for hire?
You're very welcome, Fi.
So we had another unit \n on standby for just such \n an occasion.

Hahaha! I don't care how 
 tough you two are, we'll 
 put you down with sheer 
 numbers.
So we were just bait!?
Thank you for helping us \n pull off this delivery, \n Kat.
We knew Vogo would put \n up a fight!
I figured they'd be safe \n if we kept the other \n shippers distracted.
Okay, good luck, Fi!
Tch, we can't let this \n spill over into \n Havina...
Guess you can't \n pick your family...
Leave it to me.
I asked our staff to \n make the delivery.
We're surrounded...
Empty? \n As in... Empty!?
But we've made the \n delivery, safe and \n sound.
But, Vogo, that's-
Just keep your \n mouth shut!
Arguing about work?
Fi keeps going on and on \n about adding more \n security.

While, yeah, sure, our 
 competitors like to 
 hassle us from time to 
 time...
I can't justify the \n expenditures.
Vogo, if they were just \n "hassling" us, I \n wouldn't be arguing.

You've got to see our 
 competitors are 
 growing more and 
 more cutthroat.
But a security \n force would bleed \n my wallet dry!
There must be a better \n way. Innovate! Use your \n mind, not my money.

Maybe you should look 
 at why you have so 
 many enemies in the 
 first place.
Change things, make Sun \n Shipping a respectable \n business, you know?
Now YOU'RE starting \n in on me!
Wait, I've got an idea! \n I can help.
We're doing just fine \n without you.
Thank you for the offer, \n Kat. We can use all the \n help we can get.
One Gravity Shifter is \n worth a hundred security \n guards.
Right? I'll even help \n you this once for free.
That's your favorite \n price, Vogo. How \n about it?

Fine! Do whatever you 
 want as long as it 
 doesn't cost me 
 anything.

We've got a deal then - 
 you'll help me protect 
 Sun Shipping's 
 investments.
Yep, leave it to me!
Is this what we're \n delivering?

Yep! I pulled one over 
 on the competition and 
 got an exclusive 
 delivery contract!
*Sigh* No wonder \n everyone's out to \n get Vogo....
Wait, where's your crew?
I assigned them \n to another job.
Wait!? So I'm the only \n security on this?
I hope I'm gonna be \n alright... Vogo has a \n lot of enemies.
If you're done chatting, \n you've got work to do! \n Look up!
That's the president of \n our biggest rival.
You better stop this \n shipment or I'll have \n to stop it for you.
Vogo! You cost us a huge \n contract with all your \n connivery.
Now it's time \n for you to pay!
He looks angry. \n What did you \n do to him?
I just had a little fun \n with him before his \n meeting with a client.

You see, I covered his 
 chair with a strong glue 
 so he couldn't make the 
 appointment.

You what!? I should've 
 known what I was getting 
 into when I agreed to 
 help you...

Shipping is a tough 
 business - you've gotta 
 be willing to do what it 
 takes to survive.

No one likes you, Vogo. 
 Heck, all you could get 
 for protection is one 
 scrawny little girl.
Soldiers, \n get them!
Oof! He employed a bunch \n of ex-Garrison soldiers \n for mercenaries.
We might be in for a \n little trouble.
Vogo, take the helm.
Fi?
Kat, you take the \n foredeck, I'll take the \n back.
With you helping, \n we just might be able \n to handle this.
They beat us with \n just two people!? \n How is that possible?
Hah, that was \n easy-peasy...
Defeat the Troops \n on the Transport Boat
I'm leaving those ones to you!
Fi: \n Be careful, Shifter.
Fi: \n Here come some more.
There are a ton of 'em this time!
They took over the ship!
Phew, we held 'em off.
I need to stay with the transport boat.
Let's just take 'em down one-by-one.
We're getting swarmed here...
We've got to reduce their numbers!
We're mopping 'em up!
Just a few more to go.
Ah, the cargo!
Fi: \n Don't worry about it, focus on the enemies.
Fi, feel free to take a breather.
Fi: \n I'm doing just fine.
I've gotta get back to the boat.
Take out the Troops \n on the Landing Craft
Fi: \n Leave the transport boat to me.
I'll be back as soon as I can!
I think I'm done here, now to go help Fi!
Help Fi
Vogo, how many enemies do you have!?
Attacking from a distance? That's cheating!
They took over the ship!
We took care of the mercenaries, Vogo!
I need to stay with the transport boat.
They're attacking the ship! We've gotta take 'em out.
They're after the cargo!
Fi: \n Forget about the cargo, take the enemy out first.
Defend the Transport Ship \n Until it Docks
Fi: \n They don't give up, do they?
Fi, you've got my back?
They just keep coming and coming!
Fi: \n Let's push them back!
They're not pulling any punches!
More!?
Fi: \n I think I'm hitting my limit.
Two of them!?
Fi: \n Can you take out those armored enemies?
Fi: \n We're almost there, just a little longer.
They took over the ship!
Vogo: \n I can see the dock, we're almost there!
I need to stay with the transport boat.
Leave the big guy to me, take out the soldiers.
Fi: \n Right.
Oh no, the cargo!
Fi: \n Forget the cargo, focus on the enemies!
